summary.span: 表示时间上的一刻，通常以日期和当天的时间表示。

span.span: Represents an instant in time, typically expressed as a date and time of day.

remarks.format: ## 示例代码的快速链接Quick links to example code [!INCLUDE[interactive-note](~/includes/csharp-interactive-with-utc-note.md)] 本文包括使用的几个示例`DateTime`类型：This article includes several examples that use the `DateTime` type: **初始化示例****Initialization Examples** - [调用构造函数Invoke a constructor](#initialization-01) - [调用隐式默认构造函数Invoke the implicit default constructor](#initialization-02) - [分配的返回值Assignment from return value](#initialization-03) - [分析一个字符串，表示日期和时间Parsing a string that represents a date and time](#initialization-04) - [Visual Basic 语法来初始化日期和时间Visual Basic syntax to initialize a date and time](#initialization-05) **格式设置`DateTime`以字符串形式的对象****Formatting `DateTime` objects as strings** - [使用默认日期时间格式Use the default date time format](#formatting-01) - [设置日期和时间使用非特定区域性的格式Format a date and time using a specific culture](#formatting-02) - [使用标准或自定义格式字符串的日期时间格式Format a date time using a standard or custom format string](#formatting-03) - [指定一个格式字符串和特定区域性Specify both a format string and a specific culture](#formatting-04) - [使用 web 服务的 ISO 8601 标准日期时间格式Format a date time using the ISO 8601 standard for web services](#formatting-05) **分析字符串作为`DateTime`对象****Parsing strings as `DateTime` objects** - [使用`Parse`或`TryParse`将字符串转换为日期和时间Use `Parse` or `TryParse` to convert a string to a date and time](#parsing-01) - [使用`ParseExact`或`TryParseExact`将已知格式的字符串转换Use `ParseExact` or `TryParseExact` to convert a string in a known format](#parsing-02) - [将从 ISO 8601 字符串表示形式转换为日期和时间Convert from the ISO 8601 string representation to a date and time](#parsing-03) **`DateTime` 解决方法****`DateTime` resolution** - [探索的日期和时间值的分辨率Explore the resolution of date and time values](#resolution-01) - [比较相等性的公差范围内Comparing for equality within a tolerance](#comparison-01) **区域性和日历****Culture and calendars** - [显示使用区域性特定日历的日期和时间值Display date and time values using culture specific calendars](#calendars-01) - [分析字符串根据区域性特定的日历Parse strings according to a culture specific calendar](#calendars-02) - [初始化的日期和时间从特定区域性的日历Initialize a date and time from a specific culture's calendar](#calendars-03) - [访问使用特定区域性的日历的日期和时间属性Accessing date and time properties using a specific culture's calendar](#calendars-04) - [检索使用区域性特定日历年的某一周Retrieving the week of the year using culture specific calendars](#calendars-05) **持久性****Persistence** - [为本地时区中的字符串保留日期和时间值Persisting date and time values as strings in the local time zone](#persistence-01) - [为区域性和时间的固定格式中的字符串保留日期和时间值Persisting date and time values as strings in a culture and time invariant format](#persistence-02) - [保留日期和时间值作为整数Persisting date and time values as integers](#persistence-03) - [使用保留的日期和时间值 `XmlSerializer`Persisting date and time values using the `XmlSerializer`](#persistence-04) - [使用保留的日期和时间值 `BinaryFormatter`Persisting date and time values using the `BinaryFormatter`](#persistence-05) - [保留日期和时间值的时区数据Persisting date and time values with time zone data](#persistence-06) ## 快速链接到备注主题。Quick links to Remarks topics. 本部分包含有关的许多常见用法主题`DateTime`结构：This section contains topics for many common uses of the `DateTime` struct: - [正在初始化`DateTime`对象Initializing a `DateTime` object](#initializing-a-datetime-object) - [日期时间值和其字符串表示形式DateTime values and their string representations](#datetime-values-and-their-string-representations) - [从字符串分析的日期时间值Parsing DateTime values from strings](#parsing-datetime-values-from-strings) - [日期时间值DateTime values](#datetime-values) - [DateTime 操作DateTime operations](#datetime-operations) - [日期时间解决方法DateTime resolution](#datetime-resolution) - [日期时间值和日历DateTime values and calendars](#datetime-values-and-calendars) - [保存日期时间值Persisting DateTime values](#persisting-datetime-values) - [DateTime vs。时间跨度DateTime vs. TimeSpan](#datetime-vs-timespan) - [比较相等性的公差范围内Comparing for equality within tolerance](#comparing-for-equality-within-tolerance) - [COM 互操作注意事项COM interop considerations](#com-interop-considerations) 值类型表示日期和时间的值范围从 00:00:00 （午夜），1 月 1 日 0001 午夜 11:59:59 止 （基督纪元） 通过 11:59:59 PM，到公元 9999 年 12 月 31 日The value type represents dates and times with values ranging from 00:00:00 (midnight), January 1, 0001 Anno Domini (Common Era) through 11:59:59 P.M., December 31, 9999 A.D. (C.E.)在公历。(C.E.) in the Gregorian calendar. 时间值以调用计时周期数为 100 毫微秒为单位进行衡量。Time values are measured in 100-nanosecond units called ticks. 特定日期是自午夜 12:00，公元 0001 年 1 月 1 日以来的计时周期数A particular date is the number of ticks since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 A.D. (C.E.)在日历。(C.E.) in the calendar. 数不包括将闰秒所添加的计时周期数。The number excludes ticks that would be added by leap seconds. 例如，计时周期值 31241376000000000l 表示的日期 0100 年 1 月 1 日，星期五午夜 12:00:00。For example, a ticks value of 31241376000000000L represents the date Friday, January 01, 0100 12:00:00 midnight. 一个值始终表示上下文的显式或默认日历中。A value is always expressed in the context of an explicit or default calendar. > [!NOTE] > 如果您正在使用计时周期值，你想要将转换为其他时间间隔，如分钟或秒，则应使用， ， ， ，或常量来执行此转换。If you are working with a ticks value that you want to convert to some other time interval, such as minutes or seconds, you should use the , , , , or constant to perform the conversion. 例如，若要添加的秒数表示的时钟周期到指定数值组成部分值，可以使用表达式`dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`。For example, to add the number of seconds represented by a specified number of ticks to the component of a value, you can use the expression `dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`. 您可以查看这篇文章的示例的整个集的源中任意一种[Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/)或[C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/)从 GitHub 上的 docs 存储库。You can view the source for the entire set of examples from this article in either [Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/) or [C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/) from the docs repository on GitHub. > [!NOTE] > 一种替代方法结构，使用日期和时间值中特定时区为结构。An alternative to the structure for working with date and time values in particular time zones is the structure. 结构将日期和时间信息存储在私有字段和所依据的日期和时间的分钟数与 UTC 的差异在私有字段。The structure stores date and time information in a private field and the number of minutes by which that date and time differs from UTC in a private field. 这使得值以反映特定时区中的时间，而值可以明确反映仅 UTC 和本地时区的时间。This makes it possible for a value to reflect the time in a particular time zone, whereas a value can unambiguously reflect only UTC and the local time zone's time. 有关何时使用的讨论结构或结构处理日期和时间值时，请参阅[选择之间 DateTime、 DateTimeOffset、 TimeSpan 和 TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md)。For a discussion about when to use the structure or the structure when working with date and time values, see [Choosing Between DateTime, DateTimeOffset, TimeSpan, and TimeZoneInfo](~/docs/standard/datetime/choosing-between-datetime.md). ### 初始化一个 DateTime 对象Initializing a DateTime object 可以将初始值分配到一个新`DateTime`以多种不同方式的值：You can assign an initial value to a new `DateTime` value in many different ways: - 调用构造函数，在其中指定参数的值，两者中任何一个，或使用隐式默认构造函数。Calling a constructor, either one where you specify arguments for values, or use the implicit default constructor. - 分配`DateTime`到属性或方法的返回值。Assigning a `DateTime` to the return value of a property or method. - 分析`DateTime`值的字符串表示形式。Parsing a `DateTime` value from its string representation. - 使用 Visual Basic 特定的语言功能来实例化`DateTime`。Using Visual Basic-specific language features to instantiate a `DateTime`. 下面的代码段显示每个的示例：The following code snippets show examples of each: #### 调用构造函数Invoke Constructors 调用的重载任一指定元素 （如年、 月和日或计时周期数） 的日期和时间值的构造函数。You call any of the overloads of the constructor that specify elements of the date and time value (such as the year, month, and day, or the number of ticks). 下面的代码创建一个特定的日期使用构造函数指定年、 月、 日、 小时、 分钟和秒。The following code creates a specific date using the constructor specifying the year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#1)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#1)] 在调用`DateTime`结构的隐式默认构造函数时所需`DateTime`初始化为其默认值。You invoke the `DateTime` structure's implicit default constructor when you want a `DateTime` initialized to its default value. (有关值类型的隐式默认构造函数的详细信息，请参阅[值类型](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/value-types.md)。)某些编译器还支持声明而无需显式将值分配给它的值。(For details on the implicit default constructor of a value type, see [Value Types](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/value-types.md).) Some compilers also support declaring a value without explicitly assigning a value to it. 创建没有显式初始化的值也会导致的默认值。Creating a value without an explicit initialization also results in the default value. 下面的示例阐释C# 和 Visual Basic 中的隐式默认构造函数以及声明没有在 Visual Basic 中的分配。The following example illustrates the implicit default constructor in C# and Visual Basic, as well as a declaration without assignment in Visual Basic. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#5)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Instantiation#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#5)] #### 分配一个计算的值Assigning a computed value 可以分配对象的属性或方法返回的日期和时间值。You can assign the object a date and time value returned by a property or method. 下面的示例将当前日期和时间、 当前的协调世界时 (UTC) 日期和时间和当前日期为三个新变量。The following example assigns the current date and time, the current Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) date and time, and the current date to three new variables. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#3)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#3)] #### 分析一个字符串，表示日期时间Parsing a string that represents a DateTime ， ， ，和方法都将字符串转换为其等效的日期和时间值。The , , , and methods all convert a string to its equivalent date and time value. 下面的示例使用并方法来分析字符串并将其转换为值。The following examples use the and methods to parse a string and convert it to a value. 第二个格式使用支持的窗体[ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)标准层以表示的日期和时间字符串格式。The second format uses a form supported by the [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) standard for a representing date and time in string format. 此标准表示形式通常用于传输中的 web 服务的日期信息。This standard representation is often used to transfer date information in web services. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#4)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Instantiation.cs#4)] 并方法指示字符串是否是有效表示形式值，以及如果是，执行这一转换。The and methods indicate whether a string is a valid representation of a value and, if it is, performs the conversion. #### 对于 Visual Basic 的特定于语言的语法Language-specific syntax for Visual Basic 以下 Visual Basic 语句初始化新值。The following Visual Basic statement initializes a new value. [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Instantiation#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Instantiation.vb#2)] ### 日期时间值和其字符串表示形式DateTime values and their string representations 在内部，所有值表示为 0001 年 1 月 1 日午夜 12:00:00 以来所经历的计时周期 （100 纳秒间隔数） 数。Internally, all values are represented as the number of ticks (the number of 100-nanosecond intervals) that have elapsed since 12:00:00 midnight, January 1, 0001. 实际值时显示此值的显示的方式无关。The actual value is independent of the way in which that value appears when displayed. 外观值是将值转换为其字符串表示形式的格式设置操作的结果。The appearance of a value is the result of a formatting operation that converts a value to its string representation. 日期和时间值的外观是依赖于区域性、 国际标准、 应用程序要求和个人首选项。The appearance of date and time values is dependent on culture, international standards, application requirements, and personal preference. 结构格式化日期和时间值通过重载的灵活性。The structure offers flexibility in formatting date and time values through overloads of . 默认值方法返回使用当前区域性的短日期和长时间模式的日期和时间值的字符串表示形式。The default method returns the string representation of a date and time value using the current culture's short date and long time pattern. 下面的示例使用默认值方法。The following example uses the default method. 它显示的日期和时间使用当前区域性的短日期和长时间模式。It displays the date and time using the short date and long time pattern for the current culture. EN-US 区域性是在其运行该示例的计算机上的当前区域性。The en-US culture is the current culture on the computer on which the example was run. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#1)] 您可能需要设置特定区域性中的日期，以支持 web 方案服务器可能在从客户端不同的区域性的格式。You may need to format dates in a specific culture to support web scenarios where the server may be in a different culture from the client. 指定区域性使用方法来创建在特定区域性的短日期和长时间表示形式。You specify the culture using the method to create the short date and long time representation in a specific culture. 下面的示例使用方法来显示日期和时间使用 FR-FR 区域性的短日期和长时间模式。The following example uses the method to display the date and time using the short date and long time pattern for the fr-FR culture. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#2)] 其他应用程序可能需要不同的字符串表示形式的日期。Other applications may require different string representations of a date. 方法返回通过使用当前区域性的格式设置约定的标准或自定义格式说明符定义的字符串表示形式。The method returns the string representation defined by a standard or custom format specifier using the formatting conventions of the current culture. 下面的示例使用方法以显示完整的日期和时间模式 en-us 区域性，在其运行该示例的计算机上的当前区域性。The following example uses the method to display the full date and time pattern for the en-US culture, the current culture on the computer on which the example was run. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#3)] 最后，可以指定的区域性和格式使用方法。Finally, you can specify both the culture and the format using the method. 下面的示例使用方法以显示完整的日期和时间模式为 FR-FR 区域性。The following example uses the method to display the full date and time pattern for the fr-FR culture. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#4)] 重载还可用使用自定义格式字符串来指定其他格式。The overload can also be used with a custom format string to specify other formats. 下面的示例演示如何设置格式字符串使用[ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)通常用于 web 服务的标准格式。The following example shows how to format a string using the [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) standard format often used for web services. Iso 8601 格式不具有相应的标准格式字符串。The Iso 8601 format does not have a corresponding standard format string. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#5)][!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/StringFormat.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Formatting#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/StringFormat.vb#5)] 有关格式设置的详细信息值，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)并[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about formatting values, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). ### 从字符串分析的日期时间值Parsing DateTime values from strings 分析日期和时间的字符串表示形式转换值。Parsing converts the string representation of a date and time to a value. 通常情况下，日期和时间字符串有两个不同的用法，在应用程序中：Typically, date and time strings have two different usages in applications: - 日期和时间采用各种形式，并反映当前区域性或特定区域性的约定。A date and time takes a variety of forms and reflects the conventions of either the current culture or a specific culture. 例如，应用程序允许的用户当前区域性为 EN-US 以"2013 年 12 月 15 日"或"2013 年 12 月 15 日"的形式输入日期值。For example, an application allows a user whose current culture is en-US to input a date value as "12/15/2013" or "December 15, 2013". 它允许的用户当前区域性为 en-gb 以"12/15/2013"或"15 2013 年 12 月。"的形式输入日期值It allows a user whose current culture is en-gb to input a date value as "15/12/2013" or "15 December 2013." - 预定义的格式表示日期和时间。A date and time is represented in a predefined format. 例如，应用程序序列化作为"20130103"独立于其运行该应用程序的区域性的日期。For example, an application serializes a date as "20130103" independently of the culture on which the app is running. 应用程序可能需要在当前区域性的短日期格式输入日期。An application may require dates be input in the current culture's short date format. 您使用或方法将字符串转换为区域性使用的常见日期和时间格式之一值。You use the or method to convert a string from one of the common date and time formats used by a culture to a value. 下面的示例演示如何使用转换到不同的区域性特定格式的日期字符串值。The following example shows how you can use to convert date strings in different culture-specific formats to a value. 将当前区域性更改为英语 （英国），并调用方法生成的日期和时间的字符串数组。It changes the current culture to English (Great Britain) and calls the method to generate an array of date and time strings. 然后将每个元素传递到的数组方法。It then passes each element in the array to the method. 示例输出显示在分析方法已能够成功地将每个特定于区域性的日期和时间字符串转换。The output from the example shows the parsing method was able to successfully convert each of the culture-specific date and time strings. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Parsing#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Parsing.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Parsing#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Parsing.vb#1)] 您使用并方法将字符串必须匹配特定的格式或格式转换值。You use the and methods to convert a string that must match a particular format or formats to a value. 作为分析方法的参数指定一个或多个日期和时间格式字符串。You specify one or more date and time format strings as a parameter to the parsing method. 下面的示例使用方法将必须为"yyyyMMdd"格式或"HHmmss"格式的字符串转换值。The following example uses the method to convert strings that must be either in a "yyyyMMdd" format or a "HHmmss" format to values. [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Parsing#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Parsing.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Parsing#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Parsing.vb#2)] 一个常见用途是要转换的字符串表示形式从 web 服务，通常在[ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)标准格式。One common use for is to convert a string representation from a web service, usually in [ISO 8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) standard format. 下面的代码显示了要使用的正确的格式字符串：The following code shows the correct format string to use: [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Parsing#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Parsing.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Parsing#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Parsing.vb#3)] 如果无法分析一个字符串，和方法引发异常。If a string cannot be parsed, the and methods throw an exception. 并方法返回值，该值指示转换是否成功。The and methods return a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. 应使用或性能很重要的方案中的方法。You should use the or methods in scenarios where performance is important. 日期和时间字符串在分析操作往往具有高故障率，并且异常处理将耗费大量资源。The parsing operation for date and time strings tends to have a high failure rate, and exception handling is expensive. 如果用户输入字符串，请使用这些方法或来自未知源。Use these methods if see [Parsing Date and Time Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/parsing-datetime.md). ### 日期时间值DateTime values 时间值中的说明类型通常会表示使用协调世界时 (UTC) 标准。Descriptions of time values in the type are often expressed using the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) standard. 协调世界时是国际上认可的名称为格林威治标准时间 （格林威治标准时间）。Coordinated Universal Time is the internationally recognized name for Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). 协调世界时是经度零度，UTC 原点在测量的时间。Coordinated Universal Time is the time as measured at zero degrees longitude, the UTC origin point. 夏时制不适用为 UTC。Daylight saving time is not applicable to UTC. 本地时间是相对于某个特定时区。Local time is relative to a particular time zone. 时区是时区偏移量与相关联。A time zone is associated with a time zone offset. 时区偏移量是时区的以小时的 UTC 起始点的偏移量。A time zone offset is the displacement of the time zone measured in hours from the UTC origin point. 此外，本地时间有可能受夏时制，这将添加或减去的时间间隔调整。In addition, local time is optionally affected by daylight saving time, which adds or subtracts a time interval adjustment. 通过将时区偏移量添加到 UTC 和调整为夏时制如有必要计算本地时间。Local time is calculated by adding the time zone offset to UTC and adjusting for daylight saving time if necessary. 从 UTC 原点的时区偏移量为零。The time zone offset at the UTC origin point is zero. 在文件中是适用于计算、 比较和存储日期和时间的 UTC 时间。UTC time is suitable for calculations, comparisons, and storing dates and time in files. 适用于在桌面应用程序的用户界面中显示本地时间。Local time is appropriate for display in user interfaces of desktop applications. 此外需要使用大量其他时区的时区感知应用程序 （例如许多 Web 应用程序）。Time zone-aware applications (such as many Web applications) also need to work with a number of other time zones. 如果的属性对象是，它是未指定所表示的时间是否是本地时间、 UTC 时间或某些其他时区中的某个时间。If the property of a object is , it is unspecified whether the time represented is local time, UTC time, or a time in some other time zone. ### 您[将其转换为字符串](#persisting-values-as-strings)并保留字符串。You [convert them to strings](#persisting-values-as-strings) and persist the strings. - 您[将其转换为 64 位整数值](#persisting-values-as-integers)(值属性) 和保留整数。You [convert them to 64-bit integer values](#persisting-values-as-integers) (the value of the property) and persist the integers. - 您[序列化的日期时间值](#serializing-dateTime-values)。You [serialize the DateTime values](#serializing-dateTime-values). - 您[序列化以及时区信息的日期时间值](#serializing-datetime-and-time-zone-data)。You [serialize the DateTime values along with time zone information](#serializing-datetime-and-time-zone-data). 必须确保还原的例程值不会丢失数据或引发的异常无论何种技术选择。You must ensure that the routine that restores the values doesn't lose data or throw an exception regardless of which technique you choose. 值应往返。 values should round-trip. 也就是说，原始值和还原的值应为相同。That is, the original value and the restored value should be the same. 如果原始值表示单个时间实例，它应识别的是同一时刻的还原时的时间。And if the original value represents a single instant of time, it should identify the same moment of time when it's restored. #### 以字符串形式的持久保存值Persisting values as strings 已成功还原保持以字符串形式的值遵循以下规则：To successfully restore values that are persisted as strings, follow these rules: - 做出有关特定于区域性的格式设置还原为当你保存的位置的字符串时相同的假设。Make the same assumptions about culture-specific formatting when you restore the string as when you persisted it. 若要确保在当前区域性为不同于系统保存的区域性的系统时，可以还原字符串，调用重载使用固定区域性的约定保存字符串。To ensure that a string can be restored on a system whose current culture is different from the culture of the system it was saved on, call the overload to save the string by using the conventions of the invariant culture. 调用或重载来还原该字符串使用固定区域性的约定。Call the or overload to restore the string by using the conventions of the invariant culture. 永远不会使用， ，或重载，它使用当前线程区域性的约定。Never use the , , or overloads, which use the conventions of the current thread culture. - 如果该日期表示为单个时刻，请确保它表示同一时间点还原时，即使在不同的时区。If the date represents a single moment of time, ensure that it represents the same moment in time when it's restored, even on a different time zone. 将转换前将其保存的值为协调世界时 (UTC)。Convert the value to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) before saving it. 此外可以序列化的值以及时区信息。You can also serialize the value along with time zone information. 有关此方法的详细信息，请参阅[序列化日期时间和时区数据](#TimeZone)。For more information about this approach, see [Serializing DateTime and time zone data](#TimeZone). 最常见的错误时保存所做以字符串形式的值是依靠默认值或当前区域性的格式设置约定。The most common error made when persisting values as strings is to rely on the formatting conventions of the default or current culture. 如果当前区域性不同保存和还原字符串时，会出现问题。Problems arise if the current culture is different when saving and restoring the strings. 下面的示例说明了这些问题。The following example illustrates these problems. 它将保存使用这种情况下为英语 （美国） 的当前区域性的格式设置约定的五个日期。It saves five dates using the formatting conventions of the current culture, which in this case is English (United States). 它会还原使用不同的区域性，在这种情况下为英语 （英国） 的格式设置约定的日期。It restores the dates using the formatting conventions of a different culture, which in this case is English (Great Britain). 由于两个区域性的格式设置约定各不相同，因此无法还原两个日期，和剩余的三个日期被错误地解释。Because the formatting conventions of the two cultures are different, two of the dates can't be restored, and the remaining three dates are interpreted incorrectly. 此外，如果原始的日期和时间值表示单个时刻，还原时间不正确，因为丢失时区信息。Also, if the original date and time values represent single moments in time, the restored times are incorrect because time zone information is lost. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#3)] #### 序列化的日期时间值Serializing DateTime values 您可以保留值通过序列化到流或文件，然后还原它们通过反序列化。You can persist values through serialization to a stream or file, and then restore them through deserialization. 一些指定的对象格式序列化数据。 data is serialized in some specified object format. 它们反序列化时，将还原对象。The objects are restored when they are deserialized. 格式化程序或序列化程序，如或，处理序列化和反序列化的过程。A formatter or serializer, such as or , handles the process of serialization and deserialization. 有关序列化和类型的序列化.NET Framework 支持的详细信息，请参阅[序列化](~/docs/standard/serialization/index.md)。For more information about serialization and the types of serialization supported by the .NET Framework, see [Serialization](~/docs/standard/serialization/index.md). 下面的示例使用类进行序列化和反序列化值。The following example uses the class to serialize and deserialize values. 这些值表示所有闰年天内，第 21 世纪中。The values represent all leap year days in the twenty-first century. 如果当前区域性为英语 （英国） 的系统上运行该示例，将输出表示结果。The output represents the result if the example is run on a system whose current culture is English (Great Britain). 因为已反序列化对象本身，代码无需处理日期和时间格式的区域性差异。Because you've deserialized the object itself, the code doesn't have to handle cultural differences in date and time formats. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#4)] 前面的示例不包括时间信息。The previous example doesn't include time information. 如果值表示某个时刻，表示为本地时间，将它转换从从当地时间为 UTC 之前通过调用序列化方法。If a value represents a moment in time and is expressed as a local time, convert it from local time to UTC before serializing it by calling the method. 在反序列化后，它从 UTC 转换为本地时间通过调用方法。After you deserialize it, convert it from UTC to local time by calling the method. 下面的示例使用类来序列化美国的系统上的数据太平洋标准时区并以其在美国中的系统上反序列化中央标准区域。The following example uses the class to serialize data on a system in the U.S. Pacific Standard Time zone and to deserialize it on a system in the U.S. Central Standard zone. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#5)] #### 序列化日期时间和时区的数据Serializing DateTime and time zone data 所有前面的示例假定值表示为本地时间。The previous examples all assumed that values are expressed as local times. 代码转换 UTC 与当地时间之间的值，使其反映在源和目标系统上的同一时刻。The code converted the values between UTC and local time so they reflect the same moment in time on the source and target systems. 值还可能反映在非本地时区与 UTC 时间的时间。 values may also reflect moments in time in a time zone other than local and UTC. 因为结构不识别时区，则必须序列化都值和对象，表示其时区。Because the structure is not time zone-aware, you have to serialize both the value and the object that represents its time zone. 创建同时包含其字段类型值和其所在的时区。Create a type whose fields include both the value and its time zone. 下面的示例定义`DateWithTimeZone`结构。The following example defines a `DateWithTimeZone` structure. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateWithTimeZone.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/DateWithTimeZone.vb#6)] > [!IMPORTANT] > `DateWithTimeZone`接下来两个示例，该序列化和反序列化的数组中使用结构`DateWithTimeZone`对象。The `DateWithTimeZone` structure is used in the next two examples, which serialize and deserialize an array of `DateWithTimeZone` objects. 您可以查看这篇文章的示例的整个集的源中任意一种[Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/)或[C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/)从 GitHub 上的 docs 存储库。You can view the source for the entire set of examples from this article in either [Visual Basic](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/) or [C#](https://github.com/dotnet/samples/tree/master/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/) from the docs repository on GitHub. 通过使用`DateWithTimeZone`结构，稍后可以保存日期和时间以及时区信息。By using the `DateWithTimeZone` structure, you can then persist date and time along with time zone information. 下面的示例使用类来序列化的数组`DateWithTimeZone`对象。The following example uses the class to serialize an array of `DateWithTimeZone` objects. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#7)] 下面的示例然后调用方法来反序列化。The following example then calls the method to deserialize it. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Persistence#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/Persistence.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Persistence#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/Persistence.vb#8)] ### DateTime vs。TimeSpanDateTime vs. TimeSpan 并的值类型的差异在于表示时间的某个时刻，而表示时间间隔。The and value types differ in that a represents an instant in time whereas a represents a time interval. 可以用的一个实例减去从另一个用来获取对象，表示它们之间的时间间隔。You can subtract one instance of from another to obtain a object that represents the time interval between them. 也可以添加一个值为正与当前若要获取值，该值表示将来的日期。Or you could add a positive to the current to obtain a value that represents a future date. 可以添加或减去的时间间隔从对象。You can add or subtract a time interval from a object. 时间间隔可以是负数或正数，并且它们可以表示以刻度为单位，例如单位秒，或作为对象。Time intervals can be negative or positive, and they can be expressed in units such as ticks, seconds, or as a object. ### 比较相等性的公差范围内Comparing for equality within tolerance 用于相等性比较确切的有效值。Equality comparisons for values are exact. 这意味着两个值必须表示为相同数量的计时周期将被视为相等。That means two values must be expressed as the same number of ticks to be considered equal. 精度通常是不必要或甚至对于许多应用程序不正确。That precision is often unecessary or even incorrect for many applications. 通常情况下，你想要测试是否对象是**大致相等**。Often, you want to test if objects are **roughly equal**. 下面的示例演示如何比较大致等效。The following example demonstrates how to compare roughly equivalent . 声明它们相等时，它接受差异的一小块边距。It accepts a small margin of difference when declaring them equal. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Comparisons#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/System.DateTime/DateTimeComparisons.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Comparisons#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/System.DateTime/DateTimeComparisons.vb#1)] ### COM 互操作注意事项COM interop considerations 一个值传输到 COM 应用程序，然后传输回托管应用程序，被认为是往返。A value that is transferred to a COM application, then is transferred back to a managed application, is said to round-trip. 但是，仅指定时间的值不往返正如您所料。However, a value that specifies only a time does not round-trip as you might expect. 如果您保存/还原仅时间，如下午 3 点、 最后一个日期和时间为公历公元 1899 年 12 月 30 日If you round-trip only a time, such as 3 P.M., the final date and time is December 30, 1899 C.E. 下午 3:00，而不是 1 月 1日日公元 0001 年at 3:00 P.M., instead of January, 1, 0001 C.E. 在下午 3:00at 3:00 P.M. .NET Framework 和 COM 假定默认日期时指定只在时间。The .NET Framework and COM assume a default date when only a time is specified. 但是，COM 系统假定公元，1899 年 12 月 30 日的基日期时.NET Framework 采用年 1 月 1 日公元 0001 年的基日期However, the COM system assumes a base date of December 30, 1899 C.E., while the .NET Framework assumes a base date of January, 1, 0001 C.E. 当仅在时间从.NET Framework 传递到 COM 时，执行特殊处理，将时间转换为 com 使用的格式When only a time is passed from the .NET Framework to COM, special processing is performed that converts the time to the format used by COM. 当仅在时间从 COM 传递到.NET Framework 时，因为这会破坏合法的日期和时间或 1899 年 12 月 30 日之前不执行任何特殊处理。When only a time is passed from COM to the .NET Framework, no special processing is performed because that would corrupt legitimate dates and times on or before December 30, 1899. 如果日期从 COM 启动其往返，.NET Framework 和 COM 以保留日期。If a date starts its round-trip from COM, the .NET Framework and COM preserve the date. .NET Framework 和 COM 的行为意味着，如果你的应用程序往返，仅指定一次，你的应用程序必须记得修改或忽略的错误的日期，从最后对象。The behavior of the .NET Framework and COM means that if your application round-trips a that only specifies a time, your application must remember to modify or ignore the erroneous date from the final object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为生成的一天的时间表示午夜 (00: 00:00)。The time of day for the resulting is midnight (00:00:00). 将 属性初始化为 。The property is initialized to . 允许值为`year`， `month`，并`day`取决于`calendar`。The allowable values for `year`, `month`, and `day` depend on `calendar`. 如果不能使用以表示指定的日期和时间引发异常`calendar`。An exception is thrown if the specified date and time cannot be expressed using `calendar`. 命名空间提供了多个日历，包括和。The namespace provides several calendars including and . ## Examples 下面的示例调用构造函数两次实例化两个值。The following example calls the constructor twice to instantiate two values. 第一次调用实例化通过使用值对象。The first call instantiates a value by using a object. 由于波斯日历不能指定为区域性的默认日历，显示日期与波斯历需要单独调用其， ，和方法。Because the Persian calendar cannot be designated as the default calendar for a culture, displaying a date in the Persian calendar requires individual calls to its , , and methods. 构造函数的第二个调用实例化通过使用值对象。The second call to the constructor instantiates a value by using a object. 该示例将当前区域性更改为阿拉伯语 （叙利亚） 和当前区域性的默认日历更改为回历。The example changes the current culture to Arabic (Syria) and changes the current culture's default calendar to the Hijri calendar. 因为回历是当前区域性的默认日历，方法使用它来设置日期格式。Because Hijri is the current culture's default calendar, the method uses it to format the date. 还原先前的当前区域性 （这在此情况下是英语 （美国）） 时，方法使用当前区域性的默认公历日历来设置日期格式。When the previous current culture (which is English (United States) in this case) is restored, the method uses the current culture's default Gregorian calendar to format the date. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法不会更改此设置的值。This method does not change the value of this . 相反，它会返回一个新其值是此操作的结果。Instead, it returns a new whose value is the result of this operation. 所返回的属性对象是相同的`value`。The property of the returned object is the same as that of `value`. 小数部分的`value`是一小时的小数部分。The fractional part of `value` is the fractional part of an hour. 例如，4.5 相当于 4 小时 30 分 0 秒，0 毫秒，0 刻度。For example, 4.5 is equivalent to 4 hours, 30 minutes, 0 seconds, 0 milliseconds, and 0 ticks. `value`参数舍入为最接近的毫秒。The `value` parameter is rounded to the nearest millisecond. 如果结果为非终止重复十进制数字，将不会超过一小时的时间间隔转换为一小部分可能涉及到精度损失。Converting time intervals of less than an hour to a fraction can involve a loss of precision if the result is a non-terminating repeating decimal. （例如，一分钟是 0.016667 小时。）如果这是有问题，则可以使用方法，它使你可以在单个方法调用中指定的时间间隔的多个类型，并且不需要将转换为一小时的小数部分的时间间隔。(For example, one minute is 0.016667 of an hour.) If this is problematic, you can use the method, which enables you to specify more than one kind of time interval in a single method call and eliminates the need to convert time intervals to fractional parts of an hour. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将大量整数和小数部分值添加到日期和时间。The following example uses the method to add a number of whole and fractional values to a date and time. 它还说明了通过将该方法传递包含小数部分的值引起的精度损失。It also illustrates the loss of precision caused by passing the method a value that includes a fractional component. span.span: Deserializes a 64-bit binary value and recreates an original serialized object.

returns.span: 一个对象，它等效于由 方法序列化的 对象。

span.span: An object that is equivalent to the object that was serialized by the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法将当前值转换为二进制值的对象。Use the method to convert the value of the current object to a binary value. 随后，使用二进制值和方法来重新创建原始对象。Subsequently, use the binary value and the method to recreate the original object. > [!IMPORTANT] > 在某些情况下，返回值方法不是与原始值提供给方法。In some cases, the value returned by the method is not identical to the original value supplied to the method. 有关详细信息，请参阅下一部分中，"本地时间调整"。For more information, see the next section, "Local Time Adjustment". ## 本地时间调整Local Time Adjustment 表示本地时间，即协调通用时间调整为本地时区结构，其属性具有值。A local time, which is a Coordinated Universal Time adjusted to the local time zone, is represented by a structure whose property has the value . 还原本地时值由生成的二进制表示形式方法，方法可能会调整重新创建的值，以使是否不等于原始值。When restoring a local value from the binary representation that is produced by the method, the method may adjust the recreated value so that it is not equal to the original value. 在下列条件下，可能会出现这种情况：This can occur under the following conditions: - 如果本地由一个时区中序列化对象方法，然后反序列化中通过不同的时区方法中，表示所生成的本地时间自动调整对象为第二个时区。If a local object is serialized in one time zone by the method, and then deserialized in a different time zone by the method, the local time represented by the resulting object is automatically adjusted to the second time zone. 例如，考虑对象，表示本地时间的下午 3 点For example, consider a object that represents a local time of 3 P.M. 在美国执行应用程序使用太平洋时区方法以将其转换为二进制值的对象。An application that is executing in the U.S. Pacific Time zone uses the method to convert that object to a binary value. 在美国执行的另一个应用程序然后使用东部标准时间时区方法将转换为一个新的二进制值对象。Another application that is executing in the U.S. Eastern Time zone then uses the method to convert the binary value to a new object. 新值对象是下午 6 时，这表示时间作为原始的下午 3 点到相同的点The value of the new object is 6 P.M., which represents the same point in time as the original 3 P.M. 值，但将会调整为美国东部时区中的本地时间。value, but is adjusted to local time in the Eastern Time zone. - 如果本地的二进制表示形式值表示本地时区的系统中的无效时间是调用，该时间会调整，这样就有效。If the binary representation of a local value represents an invalid time in the local time zone of the system on which is called, the time is adjusted so that it is valid. 例如，从标准时间转换为夏时制发生在美国太平洋时区中 2010 年 3 月 14 日，上午 2:00，此时时间前进一小时，上午 3:00For example, the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs in the Pacific Time zone of the United States on March 14, 2010, at 2:00 A.M., when the time advances by one hour, to 3:00 A.M. 此小时间隔为无效的时间，即，不存在该时区的时间间隔。This hour interval is an invalid time, that is, a time interval that does not exist in this time zone. 下面的示例演示时的时间内此范围转换为二进制值通过方法，然后通过还原方法中，原始值调整为有效的时间。The following example shows that when a time that falls within this range is converted to a binary value by the method and is then restored by the method, the original value is adjusted to become a valid time. 您可以确定是否特定日期和时间值也可能受到修改将其传递到方法，该示例作为演示。You can determine whether a particular date and time value may be subject to modification by passing it to the method, as the example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.FromBinary#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.frombinary/cs/frombinary1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.FromBinary#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.frombinary/vb/frombinary1.vb#1)] ## 版本的注意事项Version Considerations 从.NET Framework 2.0 版中，开始结构包含私有类型的字段，它指示是否在指定的时间本地时间、 协调世界时 (UTC)，还是两者皆未，连接到专用的计时周期字段，其中包含指定的日期和时间的 100 纳秒为刻度数。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, a structure consists of a private Kind field, which indicates whether the specified time is local time, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or neither, concatenated to a private Ticks field, which contains the number of 100-nanosecond ticks that specify a date and time. 可以通过访问的计时周期数属性和 theKind 字段可以访问与属性。The number of ticks can be accessed with the property and theKind field can be accessed with the property. 在.NET Framework 2.0 中，如果您序列化之前对象而使用序列化接口，如不是手动，你需要仅计时周期中的数据进行序列化。Prior to the .NET Framework 2.0, if you serialized a object manually instead of using a serialization interface such as , you needed to serialize only the Ticks data in the . 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，必须还序列化类型的数据。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, you must also serialize the Kind data.

span.span: is less than 0 or represents a time greater than .

para.span: 通常，方法还原保存的值方法。

span.span: Ordinarily, the method restores a value that was saved by the method.

para.span: 但是，可能在以下情况下不同的两个值：

span.span: However, the two values may differ under the following conditions:

para.span: -如果序列化和反序列化值出现在不同时区中。

span.span: - If the serialization and deserialization of the value occur in different time zones.

para.span: 例如，如果值时间为中午 12:30

span.span: For example, if a value with a time of 12:30 P.M.

para.span: 在美国东部标准时间时区被序列化，并在美国然后反序列化太平洋时区，中午 12:30 的原始值

span.span: in the U.S. Eastern Time zone is serialized, and then deserialized in the U.S. Pacific Time zone, the original value of 12:30 P.M.

para.span: 调整为上午 9:30

span.span: is adjusted to 9:30 A.M.

para.span: 以反映两个时区之间的差异。

span.span: to reflect the difference between the two time zones.

para.span: -如果序列化的值表示本地时区中的无效时间。

span.span: - If the value that is serialized represents an invalid time in the local time zone.

para.span: 在这种情况下，方法调整还原值，使其在本地时区表示有效的时间。

span.span: In this case, the method adjusts the restored value so that it represents a valid time in the local time zone.

para.span: 例如，从标准时间到夏时制的转换发生在美国在 2010 年 3 月 14 日凌晨 2:00，此时时间前进一小时，上午 3 点到太平洋时区

span.span: For example, the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs in the U.S. Pacific Time zone on March 14, 2010, at 2:00 A.M., when the time advances by one hour, to 3:00 A.M.

para.span: 此小时间隔为无效的时间，即，不存在该时区的时间间隔。

span.span: This hour interval is an invalid time, that is, a time interval that does not exist in this time zone.

para.span: 下面的示例演示时的时间内此范围转换为长整型值通过方法，然后通过还原方法中，原始值调整为有效的时间。

span.span: The following example shows that when a time that falls within this range is converted to a long integer value by the method and is then restored by the method, the original value is adjusted to become a valid time.

para.span: 您可以确定是否特定日期和时间值也可能受到修改将其传递到方法，该示例作为演示。

span.span: You can determine whether a particular date and time value may be subject to modification by passing it to the method, as the example illustrates.

param.name: fileTime
param.span: 以计时周期表示的 Windows 文件时间。

span.span: A Windows file time expressed in ticks.

summary.span: 将指定的 Windows 文件时间转换为等效的 UTC 时间。

span.span: Converts the specified Windows file time to an equivalent UTC time.

returns.span: 一个表示 UTC 时间的对象，等效于由 参数表示的日期和时间。

span.span: An object that represents the UTC time equivalent of the date and time represented by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows 文件时间是 64 位值，它表示午夜 12:00，公元 1601 年 1 月 1 日起经过的 100 纳秒间隔数A Windows file time is a 64-bit value that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)协调世界时 (UTC)。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Windows 使用的文件时间记录时应用程序创建、 访问，或写入文件。Windows uses a file time to record when an application creates, accesses, or writes to a file. `fileTime`参数指定以 100 毫微秒表示的文件时间。The `fileTime` parameter specifies a file time expressed in 100-nanosecond ticks. 从.NET Framework 2.0 版开始，返回值是其属性是。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the return value is a whose property is .

exception.span: 小于零或表示大于 的时间。

param.name: d
param.span: OLE 自动化日期值。

span.span: An OLE Automation Date value.

summary.span: 返回与指定的 OLE 自动化日期等效的 。

span.span: Returns a equivalent to the specified OLE Automation Date.

returns.span: 一个对象，它表示与 相同的日期和时间。

span.span: An object that represents the same date and time as .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `d`参数是的双精度浮点数，它将日期表示的基日期，1899 年 12 月 30 日午夜之前或之后的天数。The `d` parameter is a double-precision floating-point number that represents a date as the number of days before or after the base date, midnight, 30 December 1899. 符号和整数部分`d`编码日期为正或负天的偏移量从 30 1899 年 12 月和值的小数部分的绝对值`d`将编码为天从午夜的偏移量的一小部分的时间。The sign and integral part of `d` encode the date as a positive or negative day displacement from 30 December 1899, and the absolute value of the fractional part of `d` encodes the time of day as a fraction of a day displacement from midnight. `d` 必须是介于负 657435.0 到正 2958465.99999999 之间的值。`d` must be a value between negative 657435.0 through positive 2958465.99999999. 请注意，由于日期进行编码的方式，有两种方法来表示任何时间的 30 1899 年 12 月。Note that because of the way dates are encoded, there are two ways of representing any time of day on 30 December 1899. 例如，-0.5，0.5 意味着中午 1899 年 12 月 30 天的偏移量加或减基零天仍然是基本的日期，因此从午夜的半天位移是中午。For example, -0.5 and 0.5 both mean noon on 30 December 1899 because a day displacement of plus or minus zero days from the base date is still the base date, and a half day displacement from midnight is noon. 请参阅的 OLE 自动化的详细信息。See for more information on OLE Automation.

exception.span: 日期不是有效的 OLE 自动化日期值。

span.span: The date is not a valid OLE Automation Date value.

summary.span: 将此实例的值转换为标准日期和时间格式说明符支持的所有字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the value of this instance to all the string representations supported by the standard date and time format specifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 不应假定该多次调用重载将返回相同的数据。You should not assume that multiple calls to the overloads will return identical data. 具体取决于特定的重载中，如果当前区域性更改，用户会替代单个的区域性设置，或系统的区域性数据进行更新，则可以更改此方法返回的数据。Depending on the specific overload, the data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回的字符串数组方法等效于将单独调用返回的字符串数组组合方法使用"d"、"D"、"f"、"F"、"g"、"G"、"m"、"o"、"r"、"s"、"t"、"T"、"u"、"U"和"y"标准格式字符串。The string array returned by the method is equivalent to combining the string arrays returned by separate calls to the method with the "d", "D", "f", "F", "g", "G", "m", "o", "r", "s", "t", "T", "u", "U", and "y" standard format strings. 有关标准格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information about standard format specifiers, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 使用当前区域性中的信息设置的返回值的每个元素的格式。Each element of the return value is formatted using information from the current culture. 有关当前区域性的区域性特定格式设置信息的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about culture-specific formatting information for the current culture, see . > [!IMPORTANT] > 由于此方法使用区分区域性的数据，不应假定对方法的多个调用将返回相同的数据。Because this method uses culture-sensitive data, you should not assume that multiple calls to the method will return identical data. 如果当前区域性更改，用户会替代单个的区域性设置，或系统的区域性数据进行更新，则可以更改此方法返回的数据。The data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它将显示计算机的当前区域性，在这种情况下为 EN-US 中使用的所有可能的标准日期和时间格式的日期的字符串表示形式。It displays the string representation of a date using all possible standard date and time formats in the computer's current culture, which in this case is en-US. span.span: A string array where each element is the representation of the value of this instance formatted with the standard date and time format specifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`参数可以是任何标准日期和时间格式说明符。The `format` parameter can be any of the standard date and time format specifiers. 其中包括 d、 D、 f、 F、 g、 G、 M （或 m），O （或 o），R （或 r），s、 t、 T、 u、 U 和 Y （或 y）。These include d, D, f, F, g, G, M (or m), O (or o), R (or r), s, t, T, u, U, and Y (or y). 有关详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 使用当前区域性中的信息设置的返回值的每个元素的格式。Each element of the return value is formatted using information from the current culture. 有关当前区域性的区域性特定格式设置信息的详细信息，请参阅。For more information about culture-specific formatting information for the current culture, see . > [!IMPORTANT] > 由于此方法使用区分区域性的数据，不应假定对方法的多个调用将返回相同的数据。Because this method uses culture-sensitive data, you should not assume that multiple calls to the method will return identical data. 如果当前区域性更改，用户会替代单个的区域性设置，或系统的区域性数据进行更新，则可以更改此方法返回的数据。The data returned by this method can change if the current culture changes, the user overrides individual cultural settings, or an update occurs to the system's cultural data. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它显示为当前区域性使用长日期格式说明符 ("D") 的日期的字符串表示形式。It displays the string representation of a date using the long date format specifier ("D") for the current culture. param.name: format
param.span: 标准和时间格式字符串。

span.span: A date and time format string.

param.name: provider
param.span: 一个对象，它提供有关此实例的区域性特定格式设置信息。

span.span: An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about this instance.

summary.span: 将此实例的值转换为指定的标准日期和时间格式说明符和区域性特定格式信息支持的所有字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the value of this instance to all the string representations supported by the specified standard date and time format specifier and culture-specific formatting information.

returns.span: 字符串数组，其中每个元素都表示此实例的以标准日期和时间格式说明符之一进行格式设置的一个值。

span.span: A string array where each element is the representation of the value of this instance formatted with one of the standard date and time format specifiers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 格式参数可以是任何标准日期和时间格式说明符。The format parameter can be any of the standard date and time format specifiers. 其中包括 d、 D、 f、 F、 g、 G、 M （或 m），O （或 o），R （或 r），s、 t、 T、 u、 U 和 Y （或 y）。These include d, D, f, F, g, G, M (or m), O (or o), R (or r), s, t, T, u, U, and Y (or y). 有关详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For more information, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 返回值的每个元素使用提供的特定于区域性的信息进行格式化`provider`。Each element of the return value is formatted using culture-specific information supplied by `provider`. > [!IMPORTANT] > 由于此方法使用区分区域性的数据，您不应假定对方法的多个调用将返回相同的数据，除非`provider`是表示固定区域性的对象。Because this method uses culture-sensitive data, you should not assume that multiple calls to the method will return identical data unless `provider` is a object that represents the invariant culture. 如果用户重写的单独的区域性设置，此方法返回的数据可以更改`provider`或系统的区域性数据进行更新，则如果`provider`。The data returned by this method can change if the user overrides the individual cultural settings of `provider` or if an update occurs to the system's cultural data for `provider`. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 它将显示使用 FR-FR 区域性的短日期格式说明符 ("d") 的日期的字符串表示形式。It displays the string representations of a date using the short date format specifier ("d") for the fr-FR culture. [!code-csharp[DateTime.GetDateTimeFormats#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/DateTime.GetDateTimeFormats/CS/class1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[DateTime.GetDateTimeFormats#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/DateTime.GetDateTimeFormats/VB/class1.vb#4)]

summary.span: 指示此 实例是否在当前时区的夏时制范围内。

span.span: Indicates whether this instance of is within the daylight saving time range for the current time zone.

returns.span: 如果 属性的值为 或 ，并且 的此实例的值在当前时区的夏时制范围内，则为 ；如果 为 ，则为 。

span.span: if the value of the property is or and the value of this instance of is within the daylight saving time range for the local time zone; if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可确定是否当前值处于夏时制范围内的本地时区，该值由返回属性。This method determines whether the current value falls within the daylight saving time range of the local time zone, which is returned by the property. 您可以确定时间区域是否支持检索的值来夏时制其属性。You can determine whether a time zone supports daylight saving time by retrieving the value of its property. 对于观察夏令时的时区，可以确定从夏令时转换发生通过检索时区的返回数组属性。For time zones that observe daylight saving time, you can determine when the transition to and from daylight saving time occurs by retrieving the array returned by the time zone's property. 如果当前值表示本地时区中的不明确或无效的时间，该方法返回`false`。If the current value represents either an ambiguous or an invalid time in the local time zone, the method returns `false`. 上[!INCLUDE[winxp](~/includes/winxp-md.md)]系统，方法识别只是将当前的调整规则，确定当前实例是否为夏令时时。On [!INCLUDE[winxp](~/includes/winxp-md.md)] systems, the method recognizes only the current adjustment rule when determining whether the current instance is a daylight saving time. 因此，该方法可能无法准确报告的当前实例是否是夏令时时间段内当前的调整规则生效之前。As a result, the method may not accurately report whether the current instance is a daylight saving time for periods before the current adjustment rule came into effect.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `year` 指定为 4 位基 10 数字;例如，1996。`year` is specified as a 4-digit base 10 number; for example, 1996. `year` 始终解释为公历日历中每一年。`year` is always interpreted as a year in the Gregorian calendar. 若要确定某个特定年度是否为闰年中一些其他日历，请调用日历对象的`IsLeapYear`方法。To determine whether a particular year was a leap year in some other calendar, call that calendar object's `IsLeapYear` method. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以确定 1994年和 2014年之间的年份是闰年。The following example uses the method to determine which years between 1994 and 2014 are leap years. 该示例还说明了结果时方法用于将一年添加到闰日。The example also illustrates the result when the method is used to add a year to a leap day. span.span: is less than 1 or greater than 9999.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此常量的值等效于 23:59:59.9999999(informatica UTC，12 月 31 日在公历日历中，00:00:00 UTC，10000 年 1 月 1 日之前的一个 100 毫微秒刻度线的 9999。The value of this constant is equivalent to 23:59:59.9999999 UTC, December 31, 9999 in the Gregorian calendar, exactly one 100-nanosecond tick before 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 10000. 某些日历，如，支持早于上部的日期范围。Some calendars, such as the , support an upper date range that is earlier than . 在这些情况下，尝试访问变量赋值或格式设置和分析操作中可能会引发。In these cases, trying to access in variable assignments or formatting and parsing operations can throw an . 而不是检索的值，可以检索的值中指定的区域性的最新有效的日期值属性。Rather than retrieving the value of , you can retrieve the value of the specified culture's latest valid date value from the property. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化对象表示通过其构造函数值，该值表示计时周期数。The following example instantiates a object by passing its constructor an value that represents a number of ticks. 调用构造函数之前, 示例可确保此值是大于或等于`DateTime.MinValue.Ticks`且小于或等于`DateTime.MaxValue.Ticks`。Before invoking the constructor, the example ensures that this value is greater than or equal to `DateTime.MinValue.Ticks` and less than or equal to `DateTime.MaxValue.Ticks`. 如果不是，引发。If not, it throws an . summary.span: 获取一个 对象，该对象设置为此计算机上的当前日期和时间，表示为本地时间。

span.span: Gets a object that is set to the current date and time on this computer, expressed as the local time.

value.span: 其值为当前日期和时间的对象。

span.span: An object whose value is the current local date and time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回值，该值表示当前日期和本地计算机上的时间。The property returns a value that represents the current date and time on the local computer. 请注意，没有之间的差异值，该值表示 0001 年 1 月 1 日午夜以来所经历的计时周期数和的字符串表示形式的值，该值表示的日期和时间值中特定于特定于区域性的格式。Note that there is a difference between a value, which represents the number of ticks that have elapsed since midnight of January 1, 0001, and the string representation of that value, which expresses a date and time value in a culture-specific-specific format. 有关格式设置的日期和时间值的信息，请参阅方法。For information on formatting date and time values, see the method. 下面的示例显示了大量特定于区域性的格式中的短日期和时间字符串。The following example displays the short date and time string in a number of culture-specific formats. [!code-cpp[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cpp/now1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cs/now1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Now#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/vb/now1.vb#2)] 此属性的解决方法取决于系统计时器，具体取决于基础操作系统。The resolution of this property depends on the system timer, which depends on the underlying operating system. 它通常必须介于 0.5 和 15 毫秒。It tends to be between 0.5 and 15 milliseconds. 因此，重复调用短时间间隔，例如一个循环中的属性可能返回相同的值。As a result, repeated calls to the property in a short time interval, such as in a loop, may return the same value. 属性通常用于衡量性能。The property is frequently used to measure performance. 但是，由于其低的分辨率，不适合用作基准测试工具。However, because of its low resolution, it is not suitable for use as a benchmarking tool. 更好的替代方法是使用类。A better alternative is to use the class. 从.NET Framework 2.0 版开始，返回值是其属性返回。Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, the return value is a whose property returns . > [!NOTE] > 此外可以使用属性来检索当前本地日期和时间。You can also use the property to retrieve the current local date and time. 它允许明确地表示为单个点的时间，这会使该时间值便携式计算机上本地时间。It allows a local time to be expressed unambiguously as a single point in time, which in turn makes that time value portable across computers. ## Examples 下面的示例使用和属性来检索当前本地日期和时间和当前通用协调 (UTC) 日期和时间。The following example uses the and properties to retrieve the current local date and time and the current universal coordinated (UTC) date and time. 它然后使用多个区域性的格式设置约定的值以及显示的字符串，其属性。It then uses the formatting conventions of a number of cultures to display the strings, along with the values of the their properties. [!code-cpp[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cpp/now2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/cs/now2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Now#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.datetime.now/vb/now2.vb#3)]

summary.span: 将日期和时间的字符串表示形式转换为其等效的 。

span.span: Converts the string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 本节内容：In this section: - [我调用哪个方法？Which method do I call?](#Tasks) - [要分析的字符串The string to parse](#StringToParse) - [分析和区域性约定Parsing and cultural conventions](#Culture) - [分析和样式元素Parsing and style elements](#Styles) - [返回值和 DateTime.KindThe return value and DateTime.Kind](#kind) ### 我调用哪个方法？Which method do I call? |到To|CallCall| |--------|----------| |通过使用当前区域性的约定来分析日期和时间字符串。Parse a date and time string by using the conventions of the current culture.| 重载 overload| |通过使用特定区域性的约定来分析日期和时间字符串。Parse a date and time string by using the conventions of a specific culture.| 重载 (请参阅[分析和区域性约定](#Culture)) overload (see [Parsing and Cultural Conventions](#Culture))| |分析日期和时间字符串，使用特殊的样式元素 （如空格或无空格）。Parse a date and time string with special style elements (such as white space or no white space).| 重载 overload| |分析日期和时间必须采用特定格式的字符串。Parse a date and time string that must be in a particular format.| 或 or | |分析日期和时间字符串并转换为 UTC 或本地时间。Parse a date and time string and perform a conversion to UTC or local time.| 重载 overload| |分析日期和时间字符串，而无需处理的异常。Parse a date and time string without handling exceptions.| 方法 method| |还原 （往返） 创建的日期和时间值的格式设置操作。Restore (round-trip) a date and time value created by a formatting operation.|"O"或"r"标准格式将字符串传递给方法，并调用重载，并 Pass the "o" or "r" standard format string to the method, and call the overload with | |分析跨计算机 （和可能是区域性） 的边界的固定格式的日期和时间字符串。Parse a date and time string in a fixed format across machine (and possibly cultural) boundaries.| 或方法 or method| ### 要分析的字符串The string to parse 方法尝试将转换到的日期和时间值的字符串表示形式及其等效。The method tries to convert the string representation of a date and time value to its equivalent. 尝试将输入的字符串而不引发完全分析异常。It tries to parse the input string completely without throwing a exception. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果在分析操作将因无法识别的字符串格式，而失败方法会抛出，而方法将返回`false`。If the parsing operation fails because of an unrecognized string format, the method throws a , whereas the method returns `false`. 因为异常处理可能很昂贵，所以应使用时应在分析操作成功，因为输入的源是受信任。Because exception handling can be expensive, you should use when the parsing operation is expected to succeed because the input source is trusted. 当分析故障有可能，特别是因为输入的源不受信任，或具有合理的默认值将替换为不成功分析字符串，则是更可取。 is preferable when parsing failures are likely, particularly because an input source is not trusted, or you have reasonable default values to substitute for strings that do not parse successfully. 要分析字符串可以采用以下形式之一：The string to be parsed can take any of the following forms: - 使用日期和时间部分字符串。A string with a date and a time component. - 包含日期但没有时间部分的字符串。A string with a date but no time component. 如果不存在时组件，该方法假定午夜 12:00。If the time component is absent, the method assumes 12:00 midnight. 如果日期组件具有两位数年份，它将转换为基于年份的当前区域性的当前日历或指定的区域性的当前日历 (如果使用非 null 使用重载`provider`参数)。If the date component has a two-digit year, it is converted to a year based on the of the current culture's current calendar or the specified culture's current calendar (if you use an overload with a non-null `provider` argument). - 具有包括仅月份和年份的日期组件，但没有日期号数部分的字符串。A string with a date component that includes only the month and the year but no day component. 该方法假定该月的第一天。The method assumes the first day of the month. - 具有包括仅月和日的日期组件，但没有年份部分的字符串。A string with a date component that includes only the month and the day but no year component. 该方法假定当前年份。The method assumes the current year. - 具有一次，但不包含日期组成部分的字符串。A string with a time but no date component. 该方法假定当前日期，除非您调用重载，并包含中`styles`参数，在其中用例方法采用的 1 月 1 日的日期 0001。The method assumes the current date unless you call the overload and include in the `styles` argument, in which case the method assumes a date of January 1, 0001. - 具有包含仅在一小时和 AM/PM 指示符，与不包含日期组成部分的时间组件的字符串。A string with a time component that includes only the hour and an AM/PM designator, with no date component. 该方法假定当前日期和时间为没有分钟并且没有秒数。The method assumes the current date and a time with no minutes and no seconds. 可以通过调用来更改此行为重载，并包含中`styles`参数，在其中用例方法采用的 1 月 1 日的日期 0001。You can change this behavior by calling the overload and include in the `styles` argument, in which case the method assumes a date of January 1, 0001. - 一个字符串，包含时区信息且符合 ISO 8601。A string that includes time zone information and conforms to ISO 8601. 在以下示例中，第一个字符串指定协调世界时 (UTC) 和第二个指定的时间是 7 小时的时区中早于 UTC:In the following examples, the first string designates Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and the second designates the time in a time zone that's seven hours earlier than UTC: "2008年-11-01T19:35:00.0000000Z""2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000Z" "2008年-11-01T19:35:00.0000000-07:00""2008-11-01T19:35:00.0000000-07:00" - 一个字符串，包含格林威治标准时间指示符和符合 RFC 1123 时间格式;例如：A string that includes the GMT designator and conforms to the RFC 1123 time format; for example: "周六，01 2008 年 11 月 19:35:00 GMT""Sat, 01 Nov 2008 19:35:00 GMT" - 一个字符串，包含日期和时间以及时区偏移量信息;例如：A string that includes the date and time along with time zone offset information; for example: "2009-03-01 05:42:00-5:00""03/01/2009 05:42:00 -5:00" 下面的示例通过使用这种情况下是 EN-US 区域性的当前区域性的格式设置约定分析中每个这些格式的字符串：The following example parses strings in each of these formats by using the formatting conventions of the current culture, which in this case is the en-US culture: [!code-csharp-interactive[Default parsing](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Parse/cs/Parse6.cs)] [!code-vb[Default parsing](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Parse/vb/Parse6.vb)] 如果输入的字符串表示闰日，在闰年中使用的分析方法在日历中 (请参阅[分析和区域性约定](#Culture))，则方法已成功分析字符串。If the input string represents a leap day in a leap year in the calendar used by the parsing method (see [Parsing and cultural conventions](#Culture)), the method parses the string successfully. 如果输入的字符串表示闰日中非-闰年，则该方法将引发。If the input string represents a leap day in a non-leap year, the method throws a . 因为方法会尝试分析日期的字符串表示形式，并且通过使用当前或指定的区域性，尝试跨不同的区域性分析字符串的格式设置规则的时间可能会失败。Because the method tries to parse the string representation of a date and time by using the formatting rules of the current or a specified culture, trying to parse a string across different cultures can fail. 若要分析跨不同的区域设置特定日期和时间格式，请使用的重载之一方法并提供格式说明符。To parse a specific date and time format across different locales, use one of the overloads of the method and provide a format specifier. ### 分析和区域性约定Parsing and cultural conventions 所有重载方法是区分区域性的除非要分析的字符串 (这由`s`下表中) 是否符合 ISO 8601 模式。All overloads of the method are culture-sensitive unless the string to be parsed (which is represented by `s` in the following table) conforms to the ISO 8601 pattern. 在分析操作使用中的格式设置信息对象，它派生的如下所示：The parsing operation uses the formatting information in a object that is derived as follows: |如果调用If you call|和`provider`是And `provider` is|格式设置信息派生自Formatting information is derived from| |-----------------|-----------------------|--------------------------------------------| ||-|当前线程区域性 (属性)The current thread culture ( property)| | 或 or |一个对象a object|指定对象The specified object| | 或 or |`null`|当前线程区域性 (属性)The current thread culture ( property)| | 或 or |一个对象a object| 属性The property| | 或 or |自定义实现Custom implementation| 方法The method| 当格式设置信息派生自对象，属性定义分析操作中使用的日历。When formatting information is derived from a object, the property defines the calendar used in the parsing operation. 如果使用分析日期和时间字符串对象的自定义不同的标准区域性的设置，请使用方法而不是方法来提高成功转换的可能性。If you parse a date and time string by using a object with customized settings that are different from those of a standard culture, use the method instead of the method to improve the chances for a successful conversion. 非标准日期和时间字符串可以是复杂且难以分析。A non-standard date and time string can be complicated and difficult to parse. 方法会尝试分析具有多个隐式分析模式，所有这些可能会失败的字符串。The method tries to parse a string with several implicit parse patterns, all of which might fail. 与此相反，方法要求您显式指定一个或多个可能会成功的确切的分析模式。In contrast, the method requires you to explicitly designate one or more exact parse patterns that are likely to succeed. 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"DateTimeFormatInfo 和动态数据"部分主题。For more information, see the "DateTimeFormatInfo and Dynamic Data" section in the topic. > [!IMPORTANT] > 请注意特定区域性的格式设置约定是动态的并且可以会有所变化。Note that the formatting conventions for a particular culture are dynamic and can be subject to change. 这意味着，依赖于默认值 （当前） 区域性或格式设置约定的分析操作指定对象，表示固定区域性以外区域性意外可能会失败，如果发生以下任一情况：This means that parsing operations that depend on the formatting conventions of the default (current) culture or that specify an object that represents a culture other than the invariant culture can unexpectedly fail if any of the following occurs: > > - 特定于区域性的数据或作为对.NET Framework 的现有版本的更新结果的.NET Framework 的主要或次要版本之间发生了更改。The culture-specific data has changed between major or minor versions of the .NET Framework or as the result of an update to the existing version of the .NET Framework. > - 特定于区域性的数据将反映用户首选项，可以通过改变计算机到计算机或会话到另一个会话。The culture-specific data reflects user preferences, which can vary from machine to machine or session to session. > - 特定于区域性的数据表示标准区域性或自定义区域性的设置将覆盖一个替换区域性。The culture-specific data represents a replacement culture that overrides the settings of a standard culture or a custom culture. > > 若要防止在分析数据和时间字符串与区域性数据中的更改关联的问题，可以通过使用固定区域性分析日期和时间字符串，也可以调用或方法并指定所需的格式要分析的字符串。To prevent the difficulties in parsing data and time strings that are associated with changes in cultural data, you can parse date and time strings by using the invariant culture, or you can call the or method and specify the exact format of the string to be parsed. 如果要序列化和反序列化日期和时间数据，你可以使用固定区域性的格式设置约定或可序列化和反序列化以二进制格式的值。If you are serializing and deserializing date and time data, you can either use the formatting conventions of the invariant culture, or you can serialize and deserialize the value in a binary format. > > 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"动态区域性数据"部分主题和"保存日期时间值"部分中主题。For more information see the "Dynamic culture data" section in the topic and the "Persisting DateTime values" section in the topic. ### 分析和样式元素Parsing and style elements 所有重载忽略输入字符串中的前导、 内部或尾随空白字符 (这由`s`下表中)。All overloads ignore leading, inner, or trailing white-space characters in the input string (which is represented by `s` in the following table). 日期和时间可以使用的前导空格和尾随数字符号字符 （"#"，U + 0023），对括起来并可以尾随一个或多个 NULL 字符 (U + 0000)。The date and time can be bracketed with a pair of leading and trailing NUMBER SIGN characters ("#", U+0023), and can be trailed with one or more NULL characters (U+0000). 此外，重载具有`styles`包含的一个或多个成员的参数枚举。In addition, the overload has a `styles` parameter that consists of one or more members of the enumeration. 此参数定义如何`s`应解释和分析操作应如何转换`s`为日期和时间。This parameter defines how `s` should be interpreted and how the parse operation should convert `s` to a date and time. 下表描述了每个效果上分析操作的成员。The following table describes the effect of each member on the parse operation. |DateTimeStyles 成员DateTimeStyles member|在转换时的效果Effect on conversion| -如果`s`包含时区偏移量，或者如果`s`不包含任何时区信息，但`styles`包括标志，该方法分析字符串，调用将返回值设为UTC，并设置属性设置为。- If `s` includes a time zone offset, or if `s` contains no time zone information but `styles` includes the flag, the method parses the string, calls to convert the returned value to UTC, and sets the property to .

协调世界时 ()。Coordinated Universal Time (). - 在本地时区内的时间 ()。The time in the local time zone (). - 未知时区中的时间 (xref:System.DateTimeKind.Unspecified?displayProperty=fullName >)。The time in an unknown time zone (xref:System.DateTimeKind.Unspecified?displayProperty=fullName>). 通常情况下，方法将返回对象，其属性是。Generally, the method returns a object whose property is . 但是，方法可能还执行时区转换和设置的值属性的值不同，决定`s`和`styles`参数：However, the method may also perform time zone conversion and set the value of the property differently, depending on the values of the `s` and `styles` parameters: |如果If|时区转换Time zone conversion|类型属性Kind property| |--------|--------------------------|-------------------| |`s` 包含时区信息。`s` contains time zone information.|日期和时间转换为时间以本地时区。The date and time is converted to the time in the local time zone.|| |`s` 包含时区信息，并`styles`包括标志。`s` contains time zone information, and `styles` includes the flag.|日期和时间转换为协调世界时 (UTC)。The date and time is converted to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).|| |`s` 包含 Z 或格林威治标准时间的时区指示符，并`styles`包括标志。`s` contains the Z or GMT time zone designator, and `styles` includes the flag.|日期和时间被解释为 UTC。The date and time are interpreted as UTC.|| 下面的示例将为包含时间的本地时区的时区信息的日期字符串：The following example converts date strings that contain time zone information to the time in the local time zone: [!code-csharp-interactive[System.DateTime.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Parse/cs/Parse2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.Parse#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.Parse/vb/Parse2.vb#2)] 此外可以保留的日期和时间的值属性的格式设置和使用分析操作期间标志。You can also preserve the value of a date and time's property during a formatting and parsing operation by using the flag. 下面的示例演示如何标志影响分析操作上通过使用"o"、"r"或"u"格式说明符将转换为字符串的值。The following example illustrates how the flag affects the parsing operation on values that are converted to strings by using the "o", "r", or "u" format specifier. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的日期，必须在所定义的格式的字符串表示形式`format`参数。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它还需要\<日期 > 和\<时间 > 日期和时间的字符串表示形式中的元素出现在指定的顺序`format`，并且`s`不有任何空格，而不是允许使用的`format`.It also requires that the \ and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`, and that `s` have no white space other than that permitted by `format`. 如果`format`用于定义一个日期包含任何时间元素，并且分析操作成功，则生成值具有时间为午夜 (00: 00:00)。If `format` defines a date with no time element and the parse operation succeeds, the resulting value has a time of midnight (00:00:00). 如果`format`定义的时间与任何日期元素，并且分析操作成功，则生成值具有的日期`DateTime.Now.Date`。If `format` defines a time with no date element and the parse operation succeeds, the resulting value has a date of `DateTime.Now.Date`. 如果`s`不的表示时间以特定时区和分析操作成功，所返回的属性值是。If `s` does not represent a time in a particular time zone and the parse operation succeeds, the property of the returned value is . 如果`s`确实表示特定时区中的时间和`format`允许存在的时区信息 (例如，如果`format`等同于"o"、"r"或"u"标准格式说明符，或如果它包含"z"、"zz"或"zzz"自定义格式说明符）所返回的属性值是。If `s` does represent the time in a particular time zone and `format` allows time zone information to be present (for example, if `format` is equal to the "o", "r", or "u" standard format specifiers, or if it contains the "z", "zz", or "zzz" custom format specifiers), the property of the returned value is . `format`参数是一个包含单一的标准格式说明符或一个或多个自定义格式说明符用于定义所需的格式的字符串`s`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier, or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of `s`. 有关有效的格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)或[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) or [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). > [!NOTE] > 如果`format`是一种自定义格式模式，不包含日期或时间分隔符 （例如"yyyyMMddHHmm")，则使用固定区域性的`provider`参数和最宽的窗体的每个自定义格式说明符。If `format` is a custom format pattern that does not include date or time separators (such as "yyyyMMddHHmm"), use the invariant culture for the `provider` parameter and the widest form of each custom format specifier. 例如，如果你想要在格式模式中指定小时数，指定较宽的形式"HH"，而不是更窄的窗体"H"。For example, if you want to specify hours in the format pattern, specify the wider form, "HH", instead of the narrower form, "H". 特定日期和时间的符号和字符串 （例如，在某个特定的语言中星期几的名称） 中使用`s`由定义`provider`参数，因为是精确的格式`s`如果`format`是一种标准格式说明符的字符串。The particular date and time symbols and strings (such as names of the days of the week in a particular language) used in `s` are defined by the `provider` parameter, as is the precise format of `s` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `provider`参数可以是任何以下：The `provider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示用于解释的区域性`s`。A object that represents the culture used to interpret `s`. 返回的对象及其属性定义的符号和格式设置`s`。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `s`. - 一个定义的日期和时间数据格式的对象。A object that defines the format of date and time data. - 自定义实现其方法返回对象或提供格式设置信息的对象。A custom implementation whose method returns either the object or the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用对应于当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. [!code-csharp[System.DateTime.ParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.ParseExact/cs/ParseExact1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTime.ParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTime.ParseExact/vb/ParseExact1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析的日期，必须在定义的格式的字符串表示形式`format`参数。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in a format defined by the `format` parameter. 它还要求中的日期和时间元素`s`出现在指定的顺序`format`。It also requires that the date and time elements in `s` appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果`s`不匹配的模式`format`参数，并具有定义的任何变体`style`参数，该方法将引发。If `s` does not match the pattern of the `format` parameter, with any variations defined by the `style` parameter, the method throws a . 与此相反，方法分析的字符串表示形式中任何一种可识别的格式提供程序的格式的日期对象。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 方法还允许中的日期和时间元素`s`以任何顺序出现。The method also allows the date and time elements in `s` to appear in any order. 如果`s`参数只包含时间和当前日期使用没有日期，除非`style`参数包括标志，在这种情况下的默认日期 (`DateTime.Date.MinValue`) 使用。If the `s` parameter contains only a time and no date, the current date is used unless the `style` parameter includes the flag, in which case the default date (`DateTime.Date.MinValue`) is used. 如果`s`参数包含仅日期没有时间、 午夜 (00: 00:00) 使用。If the `s` parameter contains only a date and no time, midnight (00:00:00) is used. `style`参数还确定是否`s`参数可以包含前导、 内部或尾随空格字符。The `style` parameter also determines whether the `s` parameter can contain leading, inner, or trailing white space characters. 如果`s`不包含任何时区信息，所返回的属性对象是。If `s` contains no time zone information, the property of the returned object is . 可以通过更改此行为标志，它将返回值，其属性是，或通过使用并标志，它将返回值，其属性是。This behavior can be changed by using the flag, which returns a value whose property is , or by using the and flags, which returns a value whose property is . 如果`s`包含时区信息，如有必要，转换为本地时间的时间和所返回的属性对象设置为。If `s` contains time zone information, the time is converted to local time, if necessary, and the property of the returned object is set to . 可以通过更改此行为标志将协调世界时 (UTC) 转换为本地时间并设置属性设置为。This behavior can be changed by using the flag to not convert Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to a local time and to set the property to . `format`参数定义的所需的模式`s`参数。The `format` parameter defines the required pattern of the `s` parameter. 它可以包含从一个或多个自定义格式说明符[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)表或单个标准格式说明符，用于标识预定义的模式，从[标准日期和时间格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)表。It can consist of either one or more custom format specifiers from the [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md) table, or a single standard format specifier, which identifies a predefined pattern, from the [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) table. 如果在自定义格式模式中不使用日期或时间分隔符，使用固定区域性的`provider`参数和最宽的窗体的每个自定义格式说明符。If you do not use date or time separators in a custom format pattern, use the invariant culture for the `provider` parameter and the widest form of each custom format specifier. 例如，如果你想要在该模式指定小时数，指定较宽的形式"HH"，而不是更窄的窗体"H"。For example, if you want to specify hours in the pattern, specify the wider form, "HH", instead of the narrower form, "H". > [!NOTE] > 而不是要求`s`符合一种格式以便分析操作成功，您可以调用方法并指定多个允许的格式。Rather than requiring that `s` conform to a single format for the parse operation to succeed, you can call the method and specify multiple permitted formats. 这使得更有可能会成功分析操作。This makes the parse operation more likely to succeed. `styles`参数包含一个或多个成员枚举，用于确定是否以及其中的空白区域未定义由`format`可以出现在`s`和控制分析操作的确切行为。The `styles` parameter includes one or more members of the enumeration that determine whether and where white space not defined by `format` can appear in `s` and that control the precise behavior of the parse operation. specifier string. `provider`参数可以是任何以下：The `provider` parameter can be any of the following: - 一个对象，表示用于解释的区域性`s`。A object that represents the culture used to interpret `s`. 返回的对象及其属性定义的符号和格式设置`s`。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `s`. - 一个定义的日期和时间数据格式的对象。A object that defines the format of date and time data. - 自定义实现其方法返回对象或提供格式设置信息的对象。A custom implementation whose method returns either the object or the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，则使用对应于当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例演示方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 请注意，字符串"2009 年 5 月 01 日上午 8:30"不能成功分析时`styles`参数等于因为不允许前导空格`format`。Note that the string " 5/01/2009 8:30 AM" cannot be parsed successfully when the `styles` parameter equals because leading spaces are not allowed by `format`. 此外，字符串"2009 年 5 月 01 日 09:00"不能与成功分析`format`的"MM/dd/yyyyhh:mm"因为日期字符串前面不带前导零的月份数作为`format`要求。Additionally, the string "5/01/2009 09:00" cannot be parsed successfully with a `format` of "MM/dd/yyyyhh:mm" because the date string does not precede the month number with a leading zero, as `format` requires.
